qas.question: What is the defining feature of angiosperms?
What characteristic flowers show variation in?
What do flowers provide the best external feature for doing?
What is it the function of the flower to ensure fertilization of?
What is the name of a branch system?
What is a main feature of vegatative portion of a plant?
What does the foliage-bearing part of the plant form to bear flowers?

plausible_answers.text: remarkable variation in form and elaboration

qas.question: What are some things that an elaborate branch system shows?
What does fruit with seeds provide to establish relationships among species?

plausible_answers.text: to ensure fertilization of the ovule and development of fruit containing seeds

qas.question: What is the function of the petiole?

context: The characteristic feature of angiosperms is <b5_0>the <a0_0>flower<b5_0/><a0_0/>. Flowers show <b7_0>remarkable variation in <a1_0>form and elaboration<b7_0/><a1_0/>, and provide <b8_0>the most trustworthy external characteristics<b8_0/> for <a2_0>establishing relationships among angiosperm species<a2_0/>. The function of the flower is <b9_0>to ensure fertilization of <a3_0>the ovule<a3_0/> and development of fruit containing seeds<b9_0/>. The floral apparatus may arise terminally on a shoot or from the axil of a leaf (where the petiole attaches to the stem). Occasionally, as in violets, a flower arises singly in the axil of an ordinary foliage-leaf. More typically, the flower-bearing portion of the plant is sharply distinguished from the foliage-bearing or vegetative portion, and forms a more or less elaborate branch-system called <b6_0>an <a4_0>inflorescence<b6_0/><a4_0/>.
